etymology.description: 痧(痧) (shā, "rash") + 子(子) (zi, "child; small thing"), referring to measles
etymology.interpretation: The word 痧子 (shāzi) refers to measles by combining 痧(痧) (shā, "rash"), which represents the characteristic rash associated with the disease, and 子(子) (zi, "child; small thing"), indicating something small or relating to children, as measles commonly affects young children.

examples.chinese: 他得了痧子(他得了痧子)。
当孩子暴露在阳光下时(當孩子暴露在陽光下時)，痧子容易传播(痧子容易傳播)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng háizi bàolù zài yángguāng xià shí, shāzi róngyì chuánbò.
examples.english: When children are exposed to sunlight, measles spreads easily.

examples.chinese: 医生建议及时治疗痧子(醫生建議及時治療痧子)。
examples.english: The doctor advised prompt treatment for measles.
